text: Gold pour, huge head. Like, half the glass. Loads of lace. Classic Bavarian wheat profile, banana, wheat, lighter clove, yeast in the aroma and taste. Medium body. Nothing much has changed from the Dennison days which is fine by me.

A very nice beer, great for the style, and very affordable and easy to get in Ontario. A beer that can easily be skipped when thinking of German style wheat beers from Germany...but this competes with the best of them.

Can. Complex floral and orange citrus aroma. Pours with a cloudy dark orange colour and quickly disappearing head. Good amount of carbonation. Orange and yeast sweet flavours. Medium body. Touch of bitterness in the finish.
Bavarian wheat beers are my favorite to drink, and this beer is king of Bavaria. Best served ice cold and in a glass, to bring out the aroma before sipping.

16oz can. Pours cloudy, pale, gold-ish yellow with a moderate fluffy white head. Aroma is wheat, grass, some banana, light clove, and bubblegum. Taste is bubblegum and tangy citrus up front followed by banana, wheat, clove, yeast, and a touch of lemon. Yeasty, drying finish with an odd lingering aftertaste - sort of like an artificial sweetener, but not as unpleasant. Medium body. Light fizzy carbonation. Creamy, smooth texture.

Pours hazy gold with a white head that recedes to a film. Aroma is lemon and bready malt. Taste is slightly sweet with a pretty dry finish. There are notes of lemon, wheat, a bit of banana, and a musty yeastiness. Thin to medium-thin bodied and lightly carbonated. Nothing special.
From tap. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is dry and estery. Dry, toasted and slight herbal. Bitter and toasted. Estery far finish.

Nice and fruity, cloudy.Light to medium body. Fairly sweet. Not much aroma, not much head (maybe I didnt have a fresh can). Side Launch Wheat beer is a mediocre. This is a drinkable beer but I have had much better Wheat Beers.

Looks like a hefeweisen should; nice foamy head, thorough cloud, juicy peachy gold, slightly pale. Aroma is banana, citrus, yeast, lemon curd, some brown sugar, light grass. Palate is appropriately substantial but just a tinge watery in the finish. Big banana taste, bubblegum, lemon, a touch of orange, belgian malt character - very well balanced, great in hot weather, but could use just a tinge more spice. Well above-average.

Un-Muzzling Olde Muzzlehatch Ratings, #23. 330 ml draught (I think) at Cest What in Toronto, July 2008. Fairly dark (for style) gold-amber, thick and cloudy, with a smallish but fully lasting head...very typical aroma with a touch of lemon added to the prominent, fully sweet banana and clove; nothing "special" but quite strong, forward and lovely...nice bready, sweet, lightly sticky malts in the body, with a discernible yeastiness...somewhat on the thin side, with a drier finish than usual. Very good overall, but I do remember that even at the time this had a high rep, and to me it did not come off as near the best in the world. I believe I had it later, around 2012 or so in Ottawa and felt much the same.
Can as pictured. Really nice beer, heavy on the banana sweetness, maybe a little too sweet but nothing too much. Smooth drinking. Lovely example of the style.
Canned. Hazy opaque yellow body, giant white head. The aroma is banana, flowers. The taste is fruity and very balanced.

Keg at Bar Hop. Hazy bronze body with a dense white head. Good lacing. Aroma of apricot, white bread and apple peel. Flavour of lime, creamy wheat and grass. Medium body with a smooth texture. Light fizz. Crisp and juicy.

Draft to pint glass
Consummation: Sweet lemony and yeasty. 
Adjunct: Lemon curd and yeast; cloudy yellow, no head; mediocre

Bière blonde tirant sur la blanche, avec une bonne effervescence et une bonne carbonatation. Les arômes sont excessivement fidèles au style hefeweizen, avec un gros nez de bananes, de levure allemande, de gomme balloune. En bouche, le goût me semble un peu dilué, cest doux, peut-être un peu trop, avec les mêmes impressions quau nez, mais peut-être un peu trop en douceur. Au final cest très buvable, mais le corps est peut-être un peu trop mince pour mon appréciation.
dominant citrus; I like the unfiltered characteristics. yes, its like a Bavarian wheat beer. Apparently Canada CAN produce a decent brew!
Wonderful wheat ale, taste of cloves and banana. Smooth and velvety texture. A terrific beer.

Best new world wheat beer Ive had. Very different than a weihenstephaner, for example, but reallll good. I dont know it I could drink 5-10 of them in a sitting but I have yuuuge respect for this beer.

On tap at barVolo in Toronto, served in a weizenglass.

Appearance: Golden, somewhat cloudy, with a long-lingering bright white head several fingers thick - more or less exactly what one wants to see in a hefe.

Smell: Ripe wheat ready for the harvest, wreathed through with banana and pear so thick they can almost be tasted without taking a sip, and heavy with notes of coriander and clove spice.

Taste: Beautifully well executed. The beer opens with a rush of banana flavor, which is swiftly joined by pear, white grape, and a considerable dose of coriander citrus. Clove swims in the background as the fruity flavors swirl and mingle. The aftertaste is primarily banana and bubblegum, with some coriander orange lingering a bit longer.

Mouthfeel: Thick, creamy, and fluffy, this is fairly full-bodied for a hefe.

Overall: One of the better hefes Ive had that was not brewed in Bavaria. The next time I find myself anywhere near the Side Launch distribution footprint, a decent amount of this beer will find its way home with me.

473 ml can @ Timo A. Canned on 12.08.2015.
Pours hazy golden color with a small head. Wheat and banana on the nose, pine, hops and orange. Juicy orange and apricot on the flavor, wheat, some yeast notes, faint spices, lemon and faint grassy notes. Very easy to drink, kind of juicy. Nice, a bit stuffy though.
4335

473ml can, thanks Jo for the gift. Aroma: banana, wheat and lots of cloves. App: hazy pale, small white head, no retention. Taste and palate: thin body, soft carbonation but a bit fizzy, fruity finish. Overall: a well made hefeweizen. Wish head and carbonation were better though.
Cloudy honey-like pour with citrus and banana on the nose. Smooth and creamy on the tongue with more banana and lemony citrus, with notes of yeast and spices. Refreshing and good.

Tap at the Rex in Toronto. Very cloudy yellow, basically like orange juice with pulp. Sourish wheaty aroma, sweet, somewhat doughy, same applies to flavour. Full mouthfeel, crisp, soft. Abrupt finish but otherwise decent if youre into this kind of stuff. Edit: it gets quite burning on the tongue, and in the finish... which is rather disturbing and ruins the overall impression.

0.473 can. Very hazy, milk and honey color with a small, white head. Aroma of bananas, cloves, bubblegum, wheat, and some delicate candy. Sweet taste of bananas, bubblegum, spices - not as definite as the aroma. Medium body, thin texture, and average carbonation. Finish is long, sweet, fruity, banana-like, quite pleasant. Overall not a bad beer, certainly a good find in the sea of mediocrity here in Canada.

Appearance: hazy straw with a short, short-lived white head, no lacing. (2/5) Aroma: banana, citrus, wheat, cloves. (6/10) Taste: moderate sweet, mild tart, very mild bitter. (5/10) Palate: medium-light body, lively carbonation, semi-crisp finish. (3/5)

There are GPS coordinates on the side of the can in large letters: 43º1742"N, 86º5240W. These coordinates are somewhere near (but not precisely at) the middle of Lake Michigan, and not at all near the brewery location in Collingwood, Ontario. I dont get it. I also dont entirely get this beer - its a fairly mainstream interpretation of the style, sweet enough to be mistake for a Rickards White, and really not all that interesting. (11/20)

can. Poured hazy straw coloured with a creamy white head. Citrusy aroma, yeasty note. Light-medium body, creamy carbonation, very refreshing mouthfeel, a touch dry. Light wheat malt flavour, lemon citrus, allspice, banana notes. A really nice wheat.

On tap at source. Way exceeded expectations. Great for the style. Tons going on and some really interesting spice notes. Pours a hazy yellow with a generous white head. Definite belgian spice notes happening- banana, clove and super crisp citrus notes. Pretty complex- got different flavours as beer warmed to room temp- more complexity came through. Fairly bitter finish- pretty refreshing. Slight sour notes add another level of interest. Great stuff from a new-ish brewery.
Really smooth hefeweizen with a nice strong taste of banana bread and citrus. Aroma of clovers.

Can from collingwoods LCBO A: banana, cloves, wheat app: hazy pale small white head good lacing t/p: med body with light acidic finish. Moderate carbonation. Velvety texture. O: a solid hefe particularity enjoyed the texture.

Draught @ Brothers Beer Bistro, Ottawa. Pours hazy light straw with airy white head. Clear aroma of yeast and grain, with fruity and slightly spicy touches. Sweetish flavour of banana, malt and yeast, with bitter, hoppy notes and touches of pepper. Sweetish, estery aftertaste. Refreshing and decent. 150715

Nice hefe. Pours a beautiful, bright golden orange with a thick, puffy off white head. Tons of carb. The aroma is fruity and spicy with big notes of banana, light bubblegum, clove, coriander and a bit of citrus zest. Nice and crisp wheat malts, spice is mild with a mostly fruity profile. Crushable hefe for sure.
Slightly sour yeast aroma with citrus notes. Hazy gold colour. Orange front with spiced finish. Medium body with lively carbonation. A great beer.

Fantastic beer from Collingwood. Lots of banana popsicle on the nose with light spice notes. Cloudy, golden colour in the glass that sits below a fluffy white head. Full bodied with more banana on the palate. Drinks easy and finishes smoothly. Awesome.

473ml can. Cloudy golden with a frothy white head. Flavors are wheat, banana, bubblegum, orange and cloves with herbal and floral notes. Light to medium body, good carbonation, slick texture. Dry, fruity spicy finish.

Can - 473ml. Beautiful hazy golden body with a thin, white creamy head. Decent malty/hoppy aroma with yeasty and bready hints. Its fresh malty/hoppy taste carries banana, yeasty, and herbal notes. Ends with a good bittersweet finish. Enjoyable.

Bière à la teinte bien pâle surmontée dun anneau de très grosses bulles de courte longévité. Le contenant représente bien le contenu. Au nez, on ressent de la banane (évidemment), des arômes de levures allemandes et une pointe de grains de coriandre. Ces arômes me rappellent curieusement le Ginger Ale. Est-ce un plus? Un moins? Je ne saurais dire! La bière, sans toutefois être complexe en bouche, est précise et à mon avis, réussie dans son style. On passe de la levure weiss aux blés dansant dans les champs sous une brise estivale. Ça goûte lété (pardonnez-moi cet insupportable cliché, mais cest vrai!), léger tout en étant suffisamment sucré et balancé. Le coprs est mince/moyen et les saveurs sont délicates mais agréablement assez longues en bouche. Je suis peut-être un mauvais critique dune telle bière car ce style nest pas le mien et je laurais sans doute préférée en été plutôt quen mars; je crois somme toute quelle est très réussie et mérite quon sy attarde. Accompagnerait parfaitement un bol de nacho aux échalotes et à la crème sûre!
Poured from the tap. Cloudy yellow with white head. Yeasty wheat with mild banana. Nice blend, well balanced.

Golden body, with light carbonation bubbles. Thin white cap of a head.
Wheats and yeast assault the nose, with a touch of salt and vinegar chips. A bit of white pepper stings the back of the nostrils. On the tongue its wheat, white pepper, lime and green apple.
Overall, Im very pleasantly surprised by this entry in the wheat beer arena.

Pours cloudy gold, with little head. Aroma notes include banana, cloves, citrus, yeast, and lively esters. Tasting notes include banana, coriander, cloves, and fruity esters. The palate is well balanced, with low-moderate carbonation. Excellent Wheat beer!
Classic German weizen character, banana, clove, vanilla. Quite light and carbonated like a kristallweizen, smooth and refreshing.

Big can in a stem glass. Pours hazy golden with a lacy, white head. Aroma of wheat, light banana and spicy notes, some pale malts and floral hops. Flavor the same with a nice blend of everything for the style. Average to lighter texture. A solid wheat beer.

On Draught at Ceilis Cottage, Queen Street East, Toronto, ON. 
Fruity aroma. Pours a hazy amber colour with one finger of white head.
Taste: Fruity, apricots, oranges, wheat. Medium carbonation.Nice lacing.

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2015 472ml can from the LCBO. Hazy light straw body with foamy white head. Aroma has banana, clove, cereal, and vanilla, however the banana is what propels itself to the forefront. Its got a real thin texture and a medum/soft carbonation level which makes it exceptionally sessionable for the style. Bready notes are apparent as well. Its got a little bit of malty sweetness that makes itself present upon tasting.

Pours a hazy gold with a thin spotty white head and little to no lace. Aroma is bready wheat, banana esters, and faint citrus. Flavour is citrus, mild bitterness, bready wheat, and lightly spicy clove.

473ml can pours a pale golden color with a finger of white head that leaves some spotty lacing on the glass. Aroma is grassy and grainy with some light citrus notes. Taste is a grassy and light citrus hop bitterness with a light grainy malty sweetness. From what I have been reading here this brew is highly over rated. Okay, but nothing special here.

Can. A cloudy gold with a thick fizzy head that clings to the glass. Wheaty light cloves & banana. The body is light and spritzy, interesting for a wheat beer.  The taste is quite refreshing - cloves & banana.

Great local wheat beer. No noticeable head. Cereal and yeasty aroma. Nice in the palate. A but sweet but really well balanced. Nice finish. Well done. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft - Light wheat and citrus. Cloudy yellow with a good white head. Creamy wheat and banana, with some light spice and citrus. Pretty light and decent.

Always one step behind Tiki. Sigh. Pours a cloudy gold, white head that reduces to sheet. Smells of banana and stronger wheat and bubble gum. Taste soft wheat, sweet, banana. Good but not my favourite

Pours into the glass with a cap thinner than John Waters pencil moustache. Ive had this on tap many times when it was under its former name & know its a damn fine local interpretation of the style. But is it *really* a better beer than some of the German versions rated lower? Its smooth & refreshing, with a banana Popsicle flavour profile. Theres also a slight shake of subtle spicing & squeezed lemon finish. Perhaps a little to sugary & candy-like but pretty damn decent.

Can from lcbo. Pours a cloudy straw colour with a white head. Aroma us bready with a hint if lemon zest. Light body, medium carbonation. Some light bubblegum, lemon, white bread, light clove, hint of pepper. Pretty light and refreshing. Decent enough. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

It has a very hazy golden color with head that is about inch thick and white. Texture is very oily It feels great on lips. Nose is banana, cloves and vanilla with light bread. Taste is lightly sweet with light spice. It has very soft carbonation. Normally this would be a turn off for me, but in this case it worked in its favor.

UPDATED: AUG 7, 2014 Two separate ratings of Denisons Weissbier and Side Launch wheat were combined by ratebeer. This rating is for the Side Launch version. See below for the Dension version.

Can from the LCBO. Side by side compare with Denisons Weissbier. Pours a hazy pale yellow ( a little darker than the Denison) with a two finger head that settles quickly with little lace. Nose is banana, cloves and vanilla with light bread. Taste is lightly sweet with light spice and a touch of bitter lemon. Mouth is medium light with soft carbonation. Aroma and taste are close to the Denison version but appearance and mouthfeel dont quite compare.

Can from the LCBO. Side by side compare with Side Launch Wheat. Pours pale hazy yellow (lighter than the Side Launch) with a big white head that hangs around and laces nicely. Nose is bread and banana and cloves with muted vanilla. Sweet bready start with a medium spiciness following. Mouth is medium and creamy with soft carbonation. Overall better balanced than the Side launch version with better mouthfeel and appearance.
7/4/9/4/16 Overall 4.0

Can from LCBO. Pours cloudy yellow with white head. Aroma is sweet banana, vanilla, and cloves. Taste is wheaty, with banana and bread, light spice, and a clean finish. Light creamy body. Good, but not great.Earlier Rating: 4/6/2012 Total Score: 3Can from LCBO.  Cloudy yellow.  Funky yeasty citrusy aroma.  Pretty nice taste with citrus hints, and lots of yeast.  Slightly sour finish.  Good for the style, but not my favourite style.

473 ml can from LCBO. Didnt expect much from this beer, but was pleasantly surprise. Pours a murky yellow colour with a medium white head that quickly dissipates. Aroma is citrus. Taste is citrus, spices, wheat. Quite refreshing.Earlier Rating: 11/12/2011 Total Score: 3.9One great beer! Pours a nice hazy golden colour with a creamy white head. Aroma is bananas, spices. Smooth texture.

Solid wheat. Rebranded from denisons weiss, but this new look and name is much more modern and appealing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
(can) cloudy yellow flavour with a tall white head; faint aromas of wheat, spice, banana; balanced and refreshing if not particularly strong or complex flavour

Canned sample from lcbo. Drank from a can while golfing so tough to see colour or head. Was lemony and refreshing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours murky yellow, small white head that dissipates before long. Aroma is citrus, some bananas. medium light body, lively carbonation. Taste is citrus, some spiciness, cloves, nice mix.

Cloudy pour with golden colour. Yeast, esters, vanilla and some peppery spice dominate the aroma and a hint of banana. Medium bodied, sports a rather surprisingly fast finish. lacks the pepper I was expecting from the aroma and has a little bit of stickyness to it. Not bad but not the most memorable brew in this style. Earlier Rating: 9/5/2013 Total Score: 3.4On tap. cloudy and dark yellow colour. aroma is classic, though muted, yeast and muted esters with a spicy note and a very rich cereal character. On the palate it is medium bodied but full of flavour with yeasty or banana notes, light bitterness but a rather ketchup chip finish that i dont enjoy. Overall, decent stuff I wouldnt say no to another!

473 mL can from LCBO, excited to try the new iteration of Denisons. Pour is light gold, hazy as it should be, good head retention (it lasts, even in my wet glass). Aroma is full of banana esters, lots of bubblegum as well. Citrus comes into play as well. Mouthfeel is slightly cloying, however the body is perfectly weighted, not thin yet not overly bearing either. Taste is quite sweet as to be expected, not much else to say there. Many people will like this beer- I found it quite well made, however a bit too sweet for my personal taste.Earlier Rating: 8/6/2009 Total Score: 4a wonderful beer poured bright cloudy yellow. a little spicy and a little fruity goodness and lots of wheat and yeast flavour. but i  must say the aroma was the best part with hints of caramel and a perfect balance. definitely one of my favourite wheat beers. i do prefer it on tap to the canned version.

Well well this does taste familiar indeed. Very nice fresh wheat beer, banana, citrus, clove, but all balanced and quite tasty . Woulsd have been good to have a Dennisons to follow and truly compare (maybe tomorrow) If anything this version was perhaps a tad sweeter in the finish, not my preference.
Nicely done overallEarlier Rating: 11/9/2013 Total Score: 4.2In a can from the LCBO, got to start with I love Weisbier
This one is very decent, pale colour, head is good but not as condensed as some Euro vesions.
Smelt lots of Banana, but tasted light citrus ?
Shop local this one is world class.
This is the perfect example of how a Weissbier should taste. Michael Hancocks (Denisons brewery) new brewery name but same great taste as Denisons Weissbier. Well done!
473ml can. Cloudy golden-orange body, medium white head with excellent retention. Aroma of wheat, banana, coriander, lemon. Taste of wheat, coriander, lemon juice. Interesting.

On tap at The Only Café. Lemony wheat, drinkable though not the style. Worth having once on a warm day. Lace.Earlier Rating: 5/3/2004 Total Score: 3 thought it more of a banana smoothie with a carbonation/yeast, like a yogurt kafir beverage. Nice appearance though.
On tap in Toronto. Pours a hazy gold color with large white head. Nose and flavor are banana, wheat, coriander. Medium mouthfeel, sweet finish. Not bad.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2015 Can from the LCBO. Light golden colour with white head. Classic smell and taste with bubblegum, banana coming through. Really refreshing and crisp, but not lacking for flavour. Perfect soft mouthfeel. Well done!
UPDATED: NOV 29, 2014 On tap at Black shire Pub Londonworld class wheat beer for sure lots o bubble-gum citrus and bananaNeed more for sure the ruth will like this

Pours light golden with some head but no lacing. Nose is fruity, almost berries. Notes of Cheerios, lost is bubblegum, some banana. Taste is light/med sweet and low bitterness. Light body with medium carbonation. Not bad. Like to try a more fresh can, as this one is a few months old.

Pours hazy yellow with a frothy white head - spitting image of a Bavarian hefeweizen. Aroma of banana, lemon peel, clove, cinnamon, and yeast/esters - again, spot on. Taste is very sweet up front with lots of bread/wheat, carrying through a medium body to a very, very light bitter touch. Once again, this is pretty much equal to Wiehenstephaner, Andechs, and so on. I regret waiting so long to try this.

Pours a clear pale yellow with a one finger, frothy, white head with carbonation rising to the surface.
Aroma is classic wheat beer. Banana, a hint of citrus, a hint of spice, yeast, and bread.
Taste is a bit acidic. Notes of citrus, banana, and pepper on the aftertaste.
Medium body with a medium-high, bubbly carbonation.
Very nicely done. Balanced and classic.

Can (473 ml). From czar, thanks! Hazy yellow with a low white head and little to no lacing. Aroma is of banana, wheat, coriander, pepper and cereals. Taste is slightly sweet and very similar to aroma. Light to medium body. Moderate carbonation. Very good balance. Quenching.
Bouteille partagée par Tom10101, merci Tommy! Robe dorée, collet blanc. Arôme et goût: malt, levures, bananes, épices. Tout ce qui fait une bonne hefeweizen. Bon équilibre. Rafraichissante.

Relativement blonde, un peu voilée, elle présente une mousse éphémère à grosses bulles ; au nez, elle a des notes dacidulé, dagrumes et de bananes. En bouche, discrète mais quand même veloutée, elle semble combiner un bon quart de blanche belge (agrumes discrètes) avec un trois quarts dallemande, ce quelle prétend être (pain, bananes) ; une petite pointe légèrement acide en finale. Désaltérante, plutôt savoureuse, mais pas une incontournable.

Very cloudy golden pour with a fairly short head that leaves a thin ring of lace. Very wheaty on the nose with some nice yeasty notes. Fairly spicy on the palate with lots of fruit esters, big round body. Reminiscent of the Schneider Hefe, although this one is a little lighter in body.

473 ml can. Pours a very foggy, whitish orange with a resilient white head. Aroma is banana and wheat. Flavor is orange, banana, mango, wheat, sweetbread. Finish is...sweet. Some lingering spices! Light body, watery mouthfeel, medium carbonation. Very good, easy drinking, refreshing...top notch hefeweizen.

2013/06/27 - Pours a cloudy, pale yellow color with a small, fizzy, white head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is wheat, citrus (mainly orange) and cloves. Taste is similar to nose with a slightly sour aftertaste. Mouthfeel is medium with lots of carbonation and a juicy finish. I found the flavor slightly muted and expected banana esters instead of citrus. Decently executed hefeweizen.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

can. pours hazy pale yellow with a decent white head, some retention and lacing. grainy, citrus, pepper, herbs, wheat, fresh cereals, restrained bananas, fresh fruitiness - hint of tropical. average carbonation, light body - some texture, nice grassy-citrusy and dry finish. good mouthfeel and good balance. not your classic hefe, not close to your weihen either (american wheat ale?), but very well executed, quenching and good!

Can from the LCBO. Pours a hazy golden orange with a bunch of white head that sadly dissipates a bit quickly. Smell is wheat, cloves, and a bit of sweet caramel. Palate is on the lighter side of medium bodied with good carbonation. Taste is not at all what I expected, instead of bananas, its oranges. Taste is still good, though a bit sweet and again, oranges?

Canette 473ml. De couleur dorée-jaune et voilée. Nez de levures fruitées (bananes, citron) et légèrement épicées (clou de girofle), de blé, léger de pain et de houblon herbeux. Moyenne-mince en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi quune texture légèrement crémeuse. Goût de levures fruitées aux notes acides (agrumes, surtout de citron, léger de bananes) aux notes épicées (clou de girofle) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de blé avec un léger goût de pain frais puis en finale lon retrouve une légère amertume de houblon herbeux (herbes fraîches) avec un léger regain de goût de levures. Post-goût moyen, composé dungoût de levures fruitées (zeste de citron, notes de pelures de bananes) avec un goût de blé et des notes amères de houblon herbeux.
473 mL can. Pours a pale cloudy peach with a thin white head. Aromas of peach, banana, clove, yeasty phenolics. Easy drinking with a medium body and high carbonation. A nice Canadian wheat.

Single can from the LCBO. Pours a very cloudy, golden colour with an orange hue. Big frothy head, with decent retention (but not as much as the Krombacher weizen I had last night). Soapy lacing waving around. Malty wheat nose with some light spices and Belgian Ale yeast. Hints of citrus (oranges, lemons). Mild wheat flavours with notes of bananas and very light cloves in the finish. Goes down quite nicely and well-blended all-around. Smooth overall.
A true to style, pleasure to drink beer that I enjoy year round. Excellent aroma and taste, pleasing head retention and beautiful colour.

This is a pretty good weiss. Much more traditional than any Ive tried in awhile. Not extremely potent in any once flavor, but exhibits that character you would expect of a weiss in moderation: cloves, banana, wheat, and coriander.

Completely surprised by an Ontario brewer that I picked up this week from the LCBO for its quality in this style as this province is known for its reverse Midas touch on craft breweries.

A - Excellent frothy head which remained about one inch for the entire time to consume it (10 min).  Cloudy and slight orange tinge which is consistant with this style.

S - Cloves, banana, and citrus aroma as described were pleasantly present.  Hops are subtle.

T - slightly sweet with sour overtones from the citrus.  The coriander, orange, and cloves come out on the palate which I greatly enjoyed.  Wheat taste with some bread-like flavours.

M - Higher carbonation than I like for Weissbiers but defiantly not a point of contention.  Medium bodied that ends with a creamy and slightly sour taste.
 
Overall: If you like Hoegaarden, youll love this.  I am defiantly purchasing this again and will try to replicate it in my monthly all-grain home brewing.

Serving type: Can (500ml)
Draught at Barhop, TorontoHazy deep blond color. The aroma is a bit rubbery, the flavor is breadish, the mouthfeel is smooth, low bitterness, and short final.

On tap. Nice cloudy gold with small head that subsides to ring. Slight banana aroma. Mild to medium carbonation. Clean tasting but just a hint of breadyness and banana. Very nicely brewed but kind of meh.

Can. Medium golden, slightly hazy, average white head. Aroma is sweet and wheaty, with low spice. Palate is much the same. How the fuck does this score so high? This has MINIMAL classic hefe character at best. Barely any spicy yeast esters, barely any classic banana fruit esters, no bubblegum, no creamy mouthfeel, no towering merangue of a head. The fact that this scores in the top percentile for style is an insult to the excellent German hefeweizens out there. Maybe its better on tap? It would have to be a completely new beer experience from what I just had.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Pours an extremely cloudy golden colour, with a thick creamy white head. Lighter aroma, with pronounced banana and clove scents. Taste is a light sweetness throughout. Light body, thin on the palate and a little under-carbonated. Overall an excellent wheat beer.
On draft. Pours hazy yellow with thick, frothy white head. Aroma of bread, yeast, cereal, banana, clove. Hearty taste, notes of sweetness. Clean and light. Not terribly distinct.
Great choice for those looking for a wheat beer thats not too wheaty.  Fresh and clean taste.

473ml can from wilco. 5.3% abv on the can. Cloudy lemony-golden-yellow pour, white head which fades quickly and leaves no lace, odd for a hefe. Aroma has clove and lemony notes, light banana. Taste is lemony, clovey, soft and quick banana sweetness, some tanginess, wheat malt. Dryish end, lingering wheat. Light mouthfeel, finely carbonated. A pleasant weisse.

Victory Cafe, Toronto tap: Pours a proper look for a hefe: hazy gold with a frothed up head. Aroma is lightly banana and clove. Taste is pretty much the same. This is not an adventerous weissbier, but it is one that is supremely well made. The sweetness is well controled. The body is the perfect consistancy. Everything is quite right.

Lata. Hazy golden colour, medium nice white head. Fruity banan spiced wheata roma. Good mouthfeel. Pleasant sweet like flavour of fruity banana, wheat, bit spice, light acid (in a good way). Pleasant mild to medium bitterness.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2013 This is Torontos culinary gift to the world. Ive yet to try a wheat beer that comes close. Its all about the balance here, and theres no reaching into the air for the smell and flavour lurking behind everything: like other reviewers have said, its bananas and cloves. Thats it. This is what they serve at the ACC in heaven.

NOTE: This was one of my first reviews; will re-rate next time I visit Toronto.

473mL can thanks to solidfunk. Pours hazy golden with a modest white head. Little retention. No lace. Berliner Weiss nose with sharper lemonade and mike urea. Odd trashy phenols are not helping. Not really on style. Taste is watery, soapy, just barely recognizable as hefeweizen. Soapy palate with odd slickness. Ick. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at c'est what?, was given a full pint without any head(what gives?). Aroma, clove, slight banana, wheat. Taste, to be honest I'll have to try this one again on tap elsewhere or in a can, as it came across sour and flat. Not at all what I expected from a Weiss. As it stands this is my rating, to be revisited. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

473ml can. Pours a clear yellow with a small foamy head. Looks more like a good lager than a weiss. Taste and aroma were more in keeping with the style. Light, sweet and fruity with banana and yeast. Palate was very clean and crisp. Overall, it was very good, but didnt quite meet my expectations.
Can from the almighty pushkinwow. Hazy golden with an inch of white fizzy foam. Banana and wheat aroma. Light an sweet taste.  Lots of fizz. Nice example of the style!
Can... sheared by Plovmand.. Thx man... :) ... It pours murky golden with a small white head... the aroma is banana, wheat, malt.... the flavor is wheat, spices, yeast.... and hops....

Can provided by TheJester. Thanks a bill!! 5.3% abv version. It pours hazy golden with a medium white head. The aroma is clove, banana and light citrus. The flavour is truely authentic. Banana, lots of citrus, clove and wheat. Overall quite classic but nothing outstanding.

Can. Pours hazy yellow with a thin rim of white head. Other than the head, this looks exactly like a hefeweizen should. Aroma of bananas, malt, yeast.  some spices. Excellent for the style. Aroma and Taste could be more pronounced...but I suppose thats my general grievance with the style.

(Can) Pours hazy golden with a small head. The aroma holds wheat up front with subtle notes of banana, peach, pineapples, vanilla and clove. The flavour is light sweet, light bitter and tiny acidic. Light fruity, mild spicy, phenolic and clear wheaty. The mouthfeel is clean, bright and crisp with a medium carbonation. Soft salty and wheaty finish. Light to medium bodied.

Can thanks to Aaron for the pour! Pour is very nice hazy light orange-yellow with thin head that dissipates really quickly.  Aroma brings notes of spicy yeast, hints of banana and biscuit but really on the spicy clove side of it.  Taste is really full of spicy clove and cinnamon flavors, hints of biscuit and slight fruit notes but they are really subdued, finishes a bit spicy as well.

Thanks to adneilsen for sharing - navy gold - completely diminishing head - nose of light clove, banana and bubblegum - a little bit of apricot and melon - medium dry and yeasty - a little bit of peppery character - the tail end is quite spicy and medium dry - clove and yeast in the finish, with long linging peppery flavor - good, but not the mind blowing experience I was hoping for.

Bottle @ Brandons, courtesy of pushkinwow. Huge thanks! Somewhat hazy, cloudy, yellow orange appearance with a fizzy, soda like head. Spicy, lemon, clove, carbonated, sweet aroma. Spicy, clove, ginger, lemongrass, lemon, bready, wheat malty flavor. Pretty good but a little disappointed.

Can poured into tulip.  This one is quite flavorful and creamy.  The texture stood out, as it was really silky and thick.  Taste was very fruity with bananas, lemon, and even something like light berries.  Notes of spice characteristic of hefes.  Reminded me a bit of SN Kellerwies.
i dont know why i smell blueberries.  are there blueberries?  there is graet carbonation, proper head.  aftertaste light but its a hefe..
Tallboy can, maybe I need my tampon replaced but this is kinda dumb. Im getting sour Berliner Weiss flavors. Stale naners. Meh
Pours a lightly hazy golden with a creamy off-white head.  Aroma of banana and clove.  Sweet, with a light spiciness.  Nice thirst quenching weiss.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2016 Denisons wheat beer, rated in 2011. On tap in Toronto. Nice frothy white head. Sweet yeast flavour, bananas, not as sweet or wheaty as some of the better German hefeweizens. Total 3.8
Side Launch Wheat in a can: Cloudy yellow/orange body, not much head or retention. I get a tart diacetyl element in this. This is certainly not the great beer I once had. Maybe an old can? 3.1.
Im going to leave the rating with my original rating because I think I got an old/bad can. If this happens again Ill adjust the score.

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2011 Refrigerated can complements of pushkinwow, poured into a weizen glass.  Pours cloudy light orange with yellow highlights and some floating yeast.  Aroma is light banana and clove, very little lacing, small white head that dissapates quickly, medium/light carbonation, and smooth texture.  Taste is banana, some clove, and some wheat.

Tasted at Beerbistro, Toronto on 9 July 2011. Slightly hazy pale yellow color, small whitish foamy head, light citrus aroma, medium carbonation, cheese flavor/taste, long finish. Very refreshing after a hot day!

Pour hazy golden with a big fluffy white head great lace. Aroma clove, banana, peppery, coriander, bubble gum, yeasty quite nice aroma indeed. Taste citrus, spice, banana, wheat, bubble gum. MF full body nice carb. A terrific thirst quenching summer brew very well done and highly recommended wheat.

can poured into a tulip... pours a deep golden orange honey with a big white head, the bubbles are bit to big, not tight enough, good retention, light lace... the nose is really sweet, honey, wheat, and something else really sweet I cant put my finger on... the taste is a big let down, this is bland and flavorless, the mouthfeel is way to light, doesnt taste bad, very crushable

On tap. Nice cloudy gold with small head that subsides to ring. Slight banana aroma. Mild to medium carbonation. Clean tasting but just a hint of breadyness and banana. Very nicely brewed but kind of meh.

thanks to jerc for the can!  Pours light gold and CLEAR!  Is this filtered?  thin white head.   Aroma is big wheat, clean grass malt notes and a little spicing but not so much clove, more like nutmeg or pumpkin spices.   Flavor is really good and saves the day.  It actually tastes like a cross between a light helles and a weissen.  Light grainy notes of hay and crackers with some wheat coming forward and a crisp finish of light clove spice.  Not bad.

16 0z can poured into glass; thanks to robinvboyer for can;  not much aroma; light gold hazy pour with big head; damn this went down easy...
sweet and slightly citrusy and did I say - easy to drink;  not complex but a damn good hefe!!

Great hazy golden coloured body with a large white head that tops the beer perfectly. Aroma of wheat, coriander seed, curacao, bubble gum and a lot of yeast - absolutely perfect and bright. Medium-bodied; Great wheatie body and flavour at first with a good pungent citrus and curacao flavour afterwards. Aftertaste shows a good amount of sweetness, some light yeast notes and a good fresh wheat/malt kick that lasts indefinitely. Overall, a great wheat and easily a great choice as my first beer this time up here in Canada. I sampled this pint on draught at Black Hoof (Bar/Restaurant) in Toronto, Ontario, Canada on 09-October-2009.

Thanks JoeMcPhee. hazy golden orange colour with a thin quick dissipating lace. Slight citrus, honey aroma. Thin wheat, barley flavour. Quite refreshing. A little to sweet fro my liking. Thin hint of herbs.
Hazy golden pour with large billowy head. Aromas of banana, wheat and coriander. Taste is amazing and is the benchmark for this style. Good job!

Canette de 473ml. La meilleure hefeweizen au monde..wow !!! je ne laurais pas cru quand je lai bu. La bière est dorée-jaune et légèrement trouble. Le nez offre les arômes typiques de blé avec une certaine acidité, une touche de fraise et jaurais cru que la levure utilisée était de fermentation basse. En bouche la bière est agréable, légère, elle se laisse boire à grande lampée, une bière de soif mais qui selon moi est loin dune Schneider.

(Can from Andy, TheJester)  Le liquide voilé a une couleur jaunâtre.  La mousse est frétillante.  Le nez est simple et sarticule autour dun arôme dominant de pain qui se combine avec une légère acidité citronnée.  Le goût est une suite logique des choses : le blé est goûteux, la levure pique les papilles et les épices sont introuvables.  En bouche, le liquide a un corps moyen.  Leffervescence vivante renforce les saveurs acidulées.  La texture est à la fois crémeuse et à la fois mince.  La finale est assez courte et débordante de blé.  En résumé, bonne mais drôlement modeste.

500ml can. Pours a hazy pale yellow with a huge carbonated white head. Cloudy like you would expect of a good wheat beer. Smells of wheat, banana and citrus, tastes like it smells, very smooth and clean with a dry finish, mild spice and bitterness/sweetness on the finish. Great summer beer and still quite enjoyable in the winter.

Can. Eye-pleasing glowing cloudy straw-coloured with a hint of orange; some floating yeast. Aromas of orange peel, ginger and lemon. Highly refreshing, with flavour accents of ginger, lemon zest, yeast and a mild spiciness with a minor heat kick. Quite nice.

16oz can. Thanks to Shawn for supplying... Pours a golden semi-hazy hue with a thin milky white head... Yeasty orange, lemony, with slight banana in the background... Flavors follow suit with crisp clean flavors alongside lively carbonation. Banana really comes through. Champagney like dryness on the finish. I can see the appeal on this one and would lime a fresher sample.

Big thanks to secret santa for hooking me up.  Aroma of grainy, earthy banana cream pie.   weird almost tangy old lemon note in nose but not in taste.  Can see this being awesome on tap.  Not sure how old can is, but fell a bit flat.   Dry.  Pretty good. Would be excited to try on tap
I really like this beer, Im usually not a fan of wheat beer, but props to Denisons

From a 0.5l can from the LCBO. Pours a fairly transparent golden orange. There was a large head but it disappeared as fast as one would expect from a soda. Aroma is fruity, more like oranges than the usual banana one would expect from a wheatbeer. Its not fair strong either. Palate is okay, but also feels like a soda. Very smooth though. Taste is flat and dull. More bitter than real weißbier. Bleh. Not like I was expecting much. "Authentic" yeah, sure. Though their slogan is "Far from ordinary". If you actually like German wheat beers, dont even consider this one.

aroma was almost like sweet apples. poured hazy golden yellow with small bubbly white head. very short flavour in this beer, the taste is gone almost immediately. ive heard great things about this beer so i was a little disappointed. still not bad.

Can thx to jerc. Poured out the standard murky look but the small fading white cap with little lacing .... But this Leffe glass is notorious for shitty lacing. Has a very pleasant aroma of soft banana, clove, orange, earth, wheat and a bit of bread. Tasty and citrus powered. Wheaty, lemon, orange (neither are sweet), tart, stark cloves, yummy! Light and maybe a bit thin but I dont mind because Im just enjoying drinking this. Finishes good.

Can, i hear you have to have this on draft, but i havent had that option yet.  Pours a hazy golden body with a white head.  Lighly spicy, wheat tones, light lemon grass, and a mild sweetness.  Soft and sweet with a mild body.  A nice weizen.

Canned. Hazy orangeish golden colour with a mediumsized cremy white head. Aroma is wheat, some mild spices, yeast as well as some slight toffeeish notes. Flavour is being quite much the same. Actually a very pleasant Hefeweizen.
Nice wheat beer, prob the best I have tasted. I would like to buy lots more of this. Surprisingly little head for the style. but great taste, good beer.
Can. Pours light gold with head that fades quickly. Very sweet. Very good hefeweizen. Im going to pick up a few more cans.

Big thanks to viggo for handing this out as an extra and to Azurelimits for bringing a can to a recent tasting.

A: Pours a hazy, light yellow-gold with a nice white head.

S: A bit of banana and bubblegum in the nose, but nothing too overpowering in either direction. A nice delicate balance.

T: Banana, bubblegum, and some soft wheat characteristics. Everything is pretty delicate, but overall a very good flavor.

M: Light and creamy. Good carbonation and very refreshing.

D: A very, very nice drinkable brew. Something that would definitely be a summer staple of mine if I had regular access.

Serving type: can

Reviewed on: 05-03-2010

Oh so good. If you love or like the style this is the best their is. From the can this pours a hazy-glorious-sunshiny-straw with a lovely little head that remains with the glass the whole way down followed by haphazardly lazy lacing. Aromas of cloves, banana and citrus with a lovely straw-like summer wheat malt character that instantly transports the drinker to the Manitoba wheat fields on a languid late summer afternoon. I hate getting to the bottom of the glass, but only for a moment before I remember theres more chilling in the fridge, oh happy day! 

Really this stuff is that good!

Can courtesy of Robinboyer. Thanks again! This one was pretty fresh as it was consumed only about six weeks after the canning date. It pours a light cloudy yellow with a huge white head. Very wheaty aroma with hints of clove, vanilla, and banana but not as yeasty or intensely spicy as some of the German greats. Very refreshing and a surprisingly strong noble hoppy finish. I would love to try this on tap, as it was slightly disappointing from the can. Overall though, a very above average non German hefe!

Can. Deep orange murky amber. Thin, but resilient white lacing. Excellent balance of citrus, yeast with slight spice. Clean and crisp with a well coating solid mouth feel. Deep and complex. Did not disapoint.

On tap.  Good, but not the best ever.  Pours a mildly foggy yellow/amber with a bit of head.  They threw an orange in it, but I think there was orange there anyway.  Some other citrus.  Way less yeast than Id want in a HEFEweizen.  Tasted more like a plain american wheat ale.  I missed the spiciness and sourness.  That said, it was solid.  No off flavours, very clean tasting, very easy to drink.  And it tasted good.

Can at ChrisO "Im Trying to see the Stool" pre GBBF2010 tasting. Someone told me this is the highest rated weisse beer on this site?  Is that right?  Surely not?  Smells like a Belgian wit beer.  Not as good as say regular Schneider Weisee.  Its fine, but more a lemony wit that a German Hefe.  Not the best wheat beer ever.  Not overly soapy but falls for me more into a Belgian wit style than the German hefe style, its that bland.
Pours a cloudy straw yellow with a nice foamy white head.  Aroma of banana, clove and wheat.  Taste is a sparkling, banana and spiced wheat.  Very nice beer.  Enjoy on the patio on a great day.
Bottle at ChrisOs "Raise the Roof" tasting, 31st July 2010. Very hazy yellow. Delicate flavour - lemon meringue. The wheat characteristics build as it sits in your mouth. Yummy.

Bottle 473ml. @ ChrisOs Pre-GBBF Shindig 2010.[ Raise The Roof Tasting ]. Hazy medium grey yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white to white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, wheat, moderate yeasty, fruity, yeast, clove. Flavor is moderate to light light heavy sweet and light to moderate bitter with a average duration. Body is medium, texture is watery - creamy, carbonation is soft. [20100731]

473mL can, pours very cloudy golden yellow with a tiny white head. Simple aroma of bananas, citrus and wheat. Flavour is light fruits, clove, banana, citrus and wheat, though more restrained and slightly watery on the finish. Kind of let down by this considering the rating, though its still very good.

2010 Can - Pours a hazy golden with a small white head...aroma is banana and gritty grain, lemon, light spice...flavour is light and fruity, clove, light lemon peel...seltzery on the finish...light and spritzy finish...

UPDATED: APR 17, 2011 On tap; aroma was amazing-banana, citrus, sweet. Taste though; not what I expected. It tasted very flat (I think it was off but the restaurant said it was me). The flavor was citrusy but like I said, tasted flat almost stale. Took two sips and sent back. Would not order again

Can LCBO. Pours cloudy golden yellow with generous white head - quite beautiful. Grain and citrus notes in the aroma. Medium bodied with very pleasant mouth feel. Some sweetness amidst the grainy flavour. A beautiful beer.

On tap. Finally tried this one... Beautiful bright hazy yellow with slight white head. An explosion of citrus, banana, and clove, with a wheaty texture. Exceptional fruity flavouring, while maintaining a strong weissbier character. Just awesome.

A hazed yellow golden weissen with a thick big bubbled white head. A good aroma of frothy bananas, cloves, herbal notes, and bubble gum finale. In mouth, a smooth crisp oily banana malt with light cloves finale, well balanced and classic, up to par with the best German weizens. 500 ml can from Probstk, about 4 months old.

On tap at Cest What. 5.3% ABV. Served in a english pint glass which was a touch dissapointing..... regardless, pours clear, pale straw with tight white moderate head, lacing the glass. Well noticable aromas of banana, cloves and bubblegum in comparison to other hefeweizens. Same flavours present among the medium-light and creamy body with only a minor touch of some offensive phenolics. Medium carbonation, refreshing finish with banana flavours lingering giving it a less dry like feeling. Nice beer, Ill have to try it in the appropriate glassware one day.
UPDATED: AUG 26, 2010 Cloudy yellow with a small head. Aroma has some banana and clove spice. Flavor is smooth sweet and some wheat with light spice and some fruit banana. Pretty solid.

A Mes rate. Can, big thanks to Doug the Shoemaker.Looks like a weiss. Hazy lemon yellow, slight brown hue and a thin lasting white head. Glorious wheat, banana, bubblegum and vanilla aroma. Similar flavour. Just a hint of very delicate sourness in the background. Clean as hell. Effortlessly drinkable. Fantastic wheat and vanilla aftertaste. Maybe Id just like a touch more sourness, just a touch but overall, its really hard to fault. A damn good example of the style and almost certainly worthy of its number one status for style. Thanks Doug!

473ml can from the LCBO (Dundas/Mavis)

Pours a beautiful clouded golden color with a firm head that is quick to dissipate.  I pick up some fruit (citrus and banana, and maybe even sour grape).  I find that this time around trying the cans is a much more enjoyable experience -- the first time I tried it when the beer was launched in the LCBO I was disappointed by the extreme sour/bitter flavors but it is much mellower now.  This lends credibility to the fact they had some earlier issues when first launching the beer.  Would definitely buy this again, and am glad to support the beer brewed in Toronto!

Can, thanks to our neighbor in the parking lot at DLD!  Poured near-clear honeyed golden with a dense cap of white head.  The aroma picked up sweet, toasted bananas and bubblegum with very enjoyable cracked black pepper accent to it.. exactly what I wanted out of my hefe.  The flavor opened with tart lemon rind and wheaty notes, with semi-sweet bananas following closely.. spicy pepper and tart wheat surrounded.. sweet and a bit grainy on the finish with banana and bubblegum sugars spiced up by black pepper and cloves.  Medium-bodied and well-balanced on the palate.. enough sweetness to be succulent, but not enough to mute the complementary wheat.  Excellent stuff!

On tap at Volo in Toronto, served in a Weizen glass. Hazy golden pour with a large, pillowy white head. Head mostly remains and laces very well. Aroma is primarily yeast, with banana, clove and a hint of citrus. Flavour begins a little sweet with some sour notes. Finish is long and clean, with a tiny hint of bitterness. On the palate, light-medium in body with a milky texture and soft carbonation. Overall, an excellent hefeweizen. Subtle and very well assembled. A great beer with which to kick off TBs birthday celebration, on the Volo patio on a sunny Friday afternoon. 2010-04-30

500ml can thanks to robinvboyer
Appearance : Hazy yellow no head. No lacing.

Aroma : Lots of wheat with lots of orange peel and coriander.

Taste : Lots of wheat also with orange peel. Finish is citrusy with orange peel and wheat. Small hint of dust

Overall : Very straightforward but so well made. The balance between wheat and the rest is really good in my opinion. This is highly drinkable and refreshing. The finish calls for another sip right away. This can is about 4 months old and its already showing some signs of age. I wish I will have the chance to try one fresher or on tap.The best beer of this style Ive ever had. Thanks so much Robin !

A very nice hefe.  One of the best Ive ever had I would say.  Nice cloudy hefe haze with beautiful color.  A light head that goes away after a while.  Nice flavors of banana and clove.  Only better Ive ever had is Upland Brewing with Weihstephaner (sp?) being close.

Can. Dark cloudy yellow with big creamy white head. Soft wheat and banana nose. Flavour and body start out great and seems to fade by the middle of the glass. Soft lemony banana flavour. Delicious with the first sip and lemon and plain at the finish.

Huge thanks to robinvboyer for shipping this one cross the border for me!!! Can.  Pours a unclear hazed glowing straw orange with a small fizzy very white thin creamy froth.  Aroma of faded noble hops, German macro lager-ish, faint banana and meaty yeast with balancing lemon finishing with clove and bubble-gum, well balanced.  Flavor is quite the same, seemingly a mix of green bottle lager with sweet hefe, very drinkable, quite chalky, lots of pink bubble-gum all around, light nutty meaty yeastiness.  Light bodied, chalky, super spritzy carbonation, a bit too much.  Given its reputation, I can only guess that this should remain draft only and avoid being put in cans.  Although, I would drink this regularly if I had access to it.   Very refreshing and balanced, definitely not sweet, esp. for a hefe.   Glad I have New Glarus though!

Thanks to savvy1982 for the share. 500ml can. Pours a hazy orange/yellow with a lush white head. The aroma is citric, clean and spicy. The flavor is quite citric, like orange and lemon zest. Creamy mouth feel with flavors of cloves, flowers, mustiness and a clean finish. Great weiss and I would love to drink this on a hot day.

473 ml can via trade with Brigadier - Pours a hazy light golden color with a medium size white head.  Faint lacing.  Aroma is esters, spice, and a hint of vegetables.  Flavor is esters, spice, light yeast, and herbal hops.  Has a little bit of a fizz to the finish.  A nice beer.  Thanks Nathan.

Glass, 5-ounce, draught at Volo, savoured on September 19 2009; eye: straw with a banana hue, turbid, sheet of creamy white head, nice lacing; nose: wheat, yeast, banana, light acidity; mouth: wheat, yeast, banana, light acidity, finale in banana with presence of wheat, good carbonation, medium-light body, a bit thin, refreshing; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS 

Verre, 5 onces, en fût, bue chez Volo, savourée le 19 septembre 2009; oeil : paille avec une teinte banane, trouble, couverture de mousse blanche crémeuse, bonne dentelle; nez : froment, levure, banane, légère acidité; bouche : froment, levure, banane, légère acidité, finale en banane avec présence de froment, bonne carbonatation, corps moyen-léger, un peu mince, rafraîchissante; en résumé : bien

On tap at Volo.  Maybe a bad tap, but this beer DID NOT live up to the ratings I read afterwards.  Nice thick white head to a honey coloured cloudy beer.  Lightly carbonated with a velvety smooth palate.  The aroma was slight citrus and banana, but just overpowered with doughy yeast.  Very sweet, lacked hop balance.

Can, thanks to jerc. Pours hazy orange, moderate white head that quickly reduces to naught. Spotty lacing at best. Nose is orange, cold cream, flowers, lovely creamy wheat. Flavors are in wonderful harmony, soft wheat, sweet orange, very mild spiciness, rich and delicate, would be THE most refreshing beer on the world on a hot day.

pours hazy straw yellow. Perfect hefe weiss aroma. A little funky with a distinct banana flavour. Light and refreshing with a nice almost candy like flavour with aslightly citrus aftertaste. This Id a nice well balanced hefe weiss. And from a can no less . Pretty good.
Can thanks to blutt59.  The look is cloudy, has a white head, and golden in color.  The smell is very wheaty, clove, and a weird sweetness.  The taste is wheat, sweet, and clove.

Draft at Cafe Volo. Pours a light hazy yellow color, moderate white head. Aroma of banana, clove, wheat, and some yeast. Mouthfeel is incredibly soft, very smooth. Typical weizen flavors, but they come across so nicely from the palate. Quite enjoyable.
(Can, courtesy of blutt59)  Pours a lightly hazy pale yellow body with a medium white head.  Aroma of lemon, biscuit, banana, and light clove.  Flavor of lemon, wheat, and light banana.
Can thanks to blutt59. Hazy yellow with white head. Aroma is butter, diacetyl, wheat. Flavor is butter, wheat, clove.
Looks exactly like a wheat beer should. Amazing smooth banana taste with a citrus background. Easy to drink while remaining complex and entertaining.Truly an excellent weissbier.

Can thanks to blutt59. I see the ratings, so the can must be different. Pours a light, cloudy yellow with fast fading white fizzy head. Aroma is fairly simple, light citrus and faint banana. Flavor is the same as aroma. Mouth feel is light body, watery, with high carbonation. Overall, a pretty simple, basic Hef.

On tap at Cest what.

Pours creamy pale golden, hazy, with decent pure white head.  Big aroma, yeast, banana, citrus.  Same for flavour!  Really nice!

Can provided by blutt59.

The beer pours a hazy milky yellow with a white head. The aroma is very strong bananas with not much clove. The flavor is more of the same with bananas and wheat being the most dominant. Medium, soft mouthfeel and low carbonation.

Can courtesy of blutt59. Cloudy light yellow coloring. Foamy white head. Some fruity dry notes with wheat, grain and some tart elements. Grassy bitter notes upfront on the flavor with a decent change in to fruit grain.
can, via trade with garthicus, cloudy yellow pour but didnt really do much after that, wheaty metallic aroma and flavors were anemic, clove, banana and more metallics

Can thanks to Blutt59. I am assuming this lost something when canned as I am extremely disappointed! Pours with a small white head and a murky golden body. Aroma of banana, butter, creamy vanilla and plastic. Taste is lemon, citrus, caramel and butter. Decent, but not an outstanding hefe! Medium bubbles and a dry finish. Not splendid by any means.

500 mL can.  Hazy creamsicle orange with a medium, fluffy, white head.  Nice lacing.  Wheat and banana dominate the nose, where they are joined by a little citrus and spice.  All of these work together nicely.  This perfect balance distinguishes the flavour of this hefe from others out there as well;  There is nothing here that cant be found elsewhere, but for some reason the typical hefe flavours are optimized in this beer.  Nothing out of place or out of proportion.  I think Ill have another.
500ml can.  Pours a cloudy orange / yellow with a white head.  Faint caramel, yeast, cereal, banana.  Mildly sweet taste, with notes of banana bread, lemon, with a nice bitter finish.  Excellent.

473 ml can from LCBO, served cold in a hotel rocks glass. 
App.: Cloudy bright yellow-golden with a nice white foam.
  
Aroma:  Slightly funky, typical wheat beer nose of wheat/hay, some esters, some lighter yeast notes, slightly peppery.
  
Palate:  Medium body, soft, full effervescence, feels full and round.
  
Flav.:  The funk is gone and the banana and clove esters are much more present, backed by wheat/hay and some nice yeasty notes; dry with very little bitterness, and a light, pleasant aftertaste.

The nose isnt quite there, but the flavour is spot on.
Can courtesy of matt7215.  Pours a hazy amber with a thin white head.  Smells of bananas, vegetal, coriander, sweet wheat.  Tastes of citrus, spicy, some lemons, bananas.  Decent.

On tap at the Victory Cafe. Took off the lemon slice as fast as I could. Cloudy ochre colour with slight head and nice lacing. Yeasty sweet aroma. Yeasty bread flavour with traces of bubblegum and bananas, and spices. Very nice aftertaste. One my all time favourite beers.

Tap @ Volo. A thick, frothy white head sits atop this hazy straw colored beer. Citrusy, banana wheat esters fill the nose and make way quickly to a refreshing syrupy, yeasty-fruity german white taste that is just sublime. The mouthfeel is all fine bubble and incredibly refreshing. If all wheat beers could be this good, barley would be long gone.

On tap at Cest What

After getting to town and getting settled in I had Cest What to myself for a few hours.  This was my first pint and I am glad I did not ask for just a half pour.  Spending my time enjoying it I could have had nothing else the rest of the trip and been happy.  This is an ideal hefe that is both easy drinking and flavorful.

Aroma / Appearance 
 - Hazy golden orange in hue the white head sparkled in the basement light.  Lemon rinds, orange peels, and other sharp crisp fruity aspects made this a rival for some of the better hefes I have tried in memory.

Flavor / Palate - Carbonated with a nice kick the little bit of hops jolt the senses to life.  A sea of fruity citrus (lemon and orange) makes the palate sit up and beg for more.  It tastes almost like peach champagne.  My only problem may be that after two full points of this I would be so full I could not enjoy any more.

Beer Bistro. Seriously, this is in the 99 percentile? Sure its a solid wheat beer, but thats really all it is. Good to style, some standard notes of banana, clove, grass, and honey, but nothing that would make it stand out in its class, or certainly stand out as paired against many beers of similar rating on this site. I was looking for something that would eclipse Dancing Man, and frankly, this doesnt come close. Add to the lack of complexity a pretty weak mouthfeel and not much of a finish. Okay to good, but not great.

On tap at Beer Bistro (Toronto, ON). Pours a hazy caramel color with one finger bubbly white head. Aroma is sweet and floral with notes of banana, clove, honey, wheat, yeast, grain, some light floral esters. Flavor is sweet and floral with notes of caramel, honey, clove, spice, banana, grain, yeast. Light to medium body with a pleasing light floral finish. Nice ale.

Tap at Volo.  Wow- I finally get to try this great beer!  Pours a nice hazy golden with a big lasting white head.  Aroma is very fresh, powerful wheat and doughy pils malt with a lot of phenols- clove and vanilla, esters are on the subdued side- very light banana- clean.  Flavor is earthy, doughy, spritzy clean phenolics, clove, light bubblegum, tons of bready wheaty dough- with a big full malt profile- maybe decocted?  Just very clean, big mouthfeel of malt yet so drinkable- carbonation is high- which gives a great lively palate an aftertaste.  Very awesome Hefe.

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2009 On tap at the Cool Beer Co. Brewery. Aroma is a cold lemon peel, lemoncello, and alcohol. Pours a very cloudly, darker than expected golden, with a minimal white head. Flavor is light and sweet. Good, strong lemon characters, over a thick, chewy wheatiness. A long finish in fun hops, spiciness, and creamed malt character. Delicious. I think this is solid, but not mind-blowing. The yeast characters are great. The wheat good, the hops nice, the beer refreshing, but it doesnt break any Hefe barriers. Its just a damn good, solid example. On further thought, the most astounding feature of this beer is its finish. It just goes on and on in rich lemon, wheat, and spice complexity. Theres just a depth of finish flavor that I dont get with other Hefes.

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2009 Yes, I gave it 5/5. It is not my favourite beer I have ever tasted, but it is a perfect example of the style and definitely in my top 10. It has great complexity, with a mouthfeel which rolls over your tongue multiple times exposing the depths of its flavours ranging from citrus to banana and other various flavours. A wonderful beer. Had on tap many times and enjoyed every last ounce.

Drinking from a can right now. Certainly doesnt live up to the perfection of the on-tap version, oh how I wish it were bottled and not canned! Im still going to enjoy the 12 cans I bought though because its not bad. Great to be able to take home. Loses a bit of complexity in the palate, and the aftertaste is somewhat muted in comparison to the on tap version. Still silky smooth, I have a little bit of a cold right now and therefore the flavours and aroma cannot be assessed perfectly, but it seems to have lost a little bit of the spice that is prominent in the tapped version while still retaining some nice banana flavours.

Draught at Queen and Beaver.  Pours a cloudy vibrant yellow gold with a creamy white head.  Banana, spice and cirtus aroma.  Nice wheaty flavour with notes of banana, cirtus and spice.  Lingering fruity finish; smooth, creamy mouthfeel.  Impressive.

On draft at Beer Bistro. Hazy deep yellow in colour with strong carbonation. Full on blast of banana, clove, and vanilla in the mouth, with a slightly lemony undertone. This typical German hefeweizen formula of banana, clove and mild lemony citrus is executed perfectly in the mouth, along with some added mineral-like complexity. Full wheaty mouthfeel, yet still quite refreshing. Totally worth the hype.

Tap at Cest What: Cloudy light dirty beige color weizen with a small foamy head with average retention and minimal lacing. Aroma of dominating wheat malt is very refreshing. Taste is also dominated by loads of wheat with some very subtle notes of cloves. This is missing some banana ester which I usually look for in this style. Body is quite full with good carbonation. I very enjoyed that beer but I cant say that it is necessarily the best weizen I have ever tasted.

20oz draught 
5.0% ABV 
I tried this beer on tap on April 9, 2009 at "Smokeless Joes" in Toronto, Ontario, Canada.  The beer poured a hazy yellow-gold colour with a 1" thick white head.  The aroma was wheat malt, some banana, and some spices.  The mouthfeel was medium bodied with medium carbonation.  The flavour was wheaty, slightly sweet, with a nice bitter finish.  Overall, I was disappointed in this beer.  It has a great reputation around Toronto, but I found it to be an average brew at best.

Tap @ the Black Hoof, with a couple a friends after a competition (Thanks Anna & Cara).  Food was awesome, but this was the perfect beer to compliment everything else.  Perfectly poured with a white head, and a citrus aroma.  Excellent palate - almost silky mouthfeel, but then again I was eating Foie Gras and Iberico.  But really, before the food came I I enjoyed the beer on its own so this rating is fair enough.  All in all, glad this place carried this beer.

On tap @ Beer Bistro in Toronto.  Pours hazy gold with white head.  Aroma of citrus, banana, and coriander.  Good flavor, sweet with a lot of fruit and spices.  I thought it was a very good beer, I didnt think it would be rated as high as 4.06 though.  Good Hefe though.

In short: A superior nourishing and refreshing Hefeweizen.  Believe the hype
How: Tap at Volo, Toronto
The look: Cloudy dark yellow body topped by a large white head with medium retention
In long: Nose of lemon pie, coriander and orange peels.  In mouth the beer feels very full with its big wheat body.  Bready, doughy and crisp at the same time.  Lemon pie, pancake, cloves, coriander, light acidity and tartness.  One of the rare beer that manage to be both very nourishing and very refreshing, two desirable qualities that usually dont come together, like a small ass and big tits.

Finally got to try this. Hazy orange-melon color with uneven bright white head. Not served in proper glass @ Cest What but still looks nice. Yeasty, sweet aroma. Lots of banana, orange, custard with nutmeg. Brilliantly soft mouthfeel. Creamy, silky. Fruity entry with melon and peach. Yeast stickinesss at end just enough, and ends up seeming dry and light. Lovely, admirable weissbier.

Draft @ Volo.  Pours a hazy, toasted golden color with some fine particulates; thick, creamy off-white head with great retention and lacing that coats the glass; gorgeous pour.  Nicely toasty nose, showing some lemon and husky wheat character; slightly light, with touches of clove.  Medium mouthfeel: creamy, soft, velvety texture in the mouth; perfect presence; toasty wheat, lemony citrus with light acidity, and a solid dry clove presence; not intensely dense, but complex enough while still going down like water; I wanted to drink this for hours; gorgeously presented hefeweizen.  Medium finish: toasty malts, dry cloves, and touches of vanilla and citrus; nicely dry and toasty.

Had on tap at a couple of places in Toronto. Tangy, lots of citrus, with wheat malt, banana, and spice. Relatively heavy and rich, but the lemon/sour balances the sweetness. This is certainly a decent hefeweizen with no outstanding faults, but I can’t for the life of me figure out why it is rated best in the world on this site. I don’t think it compares with the better Bavarian-made wheat beers.

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2010 Yeasty lemon banana aroma. Pale, cloudy yellow with thick white head.   Smooth banana lemon yeast. Could be more intense but on the upside it is easy drinking and perfect for large quantities on a hot summer day, cant wait now that it is easily avail in cans.

Objectively speaking:
A presumably constantly fresh and complete weizen. A sure bet in Toronto.

I like:
Pleasant and polite equilibrium between esters and phenols, aptly leaning more towards banana esters. Crisp wheaty body with excellent extraction. Creamy, pie crust reminiscent richness. Very clean instead of playing on yeasty complexity. Extremely drinkable, sweeter than average and good-looking. Sweet, but certainly tart enough to compensate.

I dislike:
Not as aromatic as Id expected. I spent a few weeks in Austria and such very good hefes are just very common over there. I imagine that there are dozens of exa,ples which are just as good.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2012 pint at the castle on king. very hazy golden with a lovely off white head that lasts forever and leaves perfect lacy rings all down the glass after every sip. aroma is pure hefe with lotsa clove, banana, yeasty goodness. the aromas are good enough on this that its the kind of pint you could never sip and leave the pub saticfied after several hours of quaffing alone. the flavours and perfectly balanced and huge for a hefe. il admit that i questioned the rating of this brew before having it and i was quite willing to completely flan it with the typical hefe 3.2 and be done but the stuff completely blew me away. i must aploigize to the company i was with during this pint because im sure that i was meant to be included in the conversation that was occuring during my time with this brew but that blank look you saw on my face was pure shock at the fabulousness of typically mundane style brought into new light. thanks castle for making this one availible in my area///////////////////////////the canning of this beer is an epic fail, totally destoys ontarios best beer. and it just keeps getting worse and worse, what a beer tragedy

Bu en fut (20 oz) à Volo (Toronto) le 9/7/08. Jaune blanchie bien brumeuse, petit collet. Arome de blé malté, épice sucré, banane et lilac. Goût de blé et d’agrume, un peu d’épice et d’herbe, très doux et plaisant. La plus aromatisé et la plus savoureuse des hefes que j’ai dégusté!
On tap at BeerBistro in Toronto. Canary yellow with a big poofy white head. Theres way more lemon flavors than banana. Has an odd burnt rubber latex aroma.

On tap @ The BeerBistro Toronto: Bright but cloudy yellow colour.  Banana, cloves and fresh friut radiate from the glass.  Powerful malty, yeasty flavours are harmoniously set against a citrussy spine.  Complex and quaffable.  Superb!

On tap at Castle on King. Orangey-yellow, quite cloudy. Appearance reminded me of pineapple juice. Small head. Strong aroma of slightly overripe bananas (it also reminds me a bit of a dental dam -- but perhaps Ive encountered an exquisitely aromatic dental dam at some point during my youth.) Some clove is also present. The beer rolls through the mouth in a manner that is somehow notable. Orange peel is prevalent. Im reminded of wild rice at the end of each sip. Sweet and loads of citrus. Banana also joins the flavour as it warms. Medium bodied. Leaves a faint, sodium-like aftertaste. "Bombastic" comes to mind. Bombastic and delicious.

On tap - Beer Bistro: Perhaps it was the candle light, but this was a beautiful, glowing yellow-orange body, simply superb looking, a pure frothy white head. Nose of yeast and wheat, some banana in there too. A delightful wheat flavour, fruit (bananas, papaya) and yeast, just lovely. This summer will be awesome, sitting on a patio or in a beergarden (or on a certain ratebeerians balcony) supping a Denisons Weissbier.

Had this one on tap at Volo.  Poured slightly cloudy yellow color with a slight orangness to it. Aroma was spicy and citrusy. Mostly a lemon aroma in this one. This was real easy to drink and one of the best wheat beers ive had.

Pint at Volo

Beautiful rocky head with a gorgeous murky lemon colour. Smells of citrus, coriander and minor notes of cloves. It is a bit dryer and less sweet then I had expected, but does taste of cereal and bananas. It has a very nice spicy lemon finish.
Had this on tap at the 2008 Pepperwood Bistro beer festival.  The banana definitely finishes strong with hints of citrus and is very smooth.  I wish this was more widely available.

On tap at the Castle. Pours a very nice hazy gold, with a large white head. The aroma is a very enticing mix of yeasty esters and malty goodness. The classic banana and clove. Taste is the same, but the sweet malt touch, almost a bit grainy, has a delicious quality all its own, sort of "barnyard"-esque, something Ive never had in a wheat beer ever before. The mouth-feel is fuller than youd expect, almost sticky, like chewy malts, kind of reminiscent of bread. Maybe its just because it was fresh, but this seems like the pinnacle of what a good hefe should be. Best in the world? I cant say, but its the best hefe-weizen Ill probably ever come across. It didnt blow me away, yet the more I think about it, the more I like it. Good thing this is a staple at the Castle because I want more!

Pint at Volo. Radiant clouded gold body under an effusive white head. Aroma of banana and citrus, with the banana dominating. This comes through nicely in the body, with accents of citrus. Wow...this is what Hoegarden can only dream of.
Brilliant yellow pour with a deep head.  The notes of citrus and banana are showing well.  The corriander shows on the plaate with the banana and the nice balanced mildly acidic finish.

Great local Toronto beer.  Easily as good, if not better, than Hoegarden.  It has a nice citrus after taste without being overpowering, and the corriander flavour is mild but noticable.  If it is on the menu, and you like wheat beer, this is definately for you.

Never has a beer so changed my mind on what exactly beer is. Amazing clove aroma opens up into a refreshing Banana and slight citrus taste, that will leave you never wanting for more..... until its gone, and you want MORE! I have to admit, it is my second favorite style of beer, so I have a soft spot for this Oakville brew. I never had the pleasure of enjoying Micheals pub down on King, but one day (cross your fingers), hopefully we could see it again. And tonnes of respect for his decision to remain small (with high quality).
Light and goldeny/orange colour, hazy, thick white lacing head.  Citrusy and wheaty.  Consistently fresh and clean.

Enjoyed 2 pitchers with family @ Victory Cafe.  Very cloudy, but bright and not pale.  Fluffy, lasting head.  I couldnt smell too much, perhaps it was me, but smelt "fresh".  Bananas are immediate, followed by lemon, and some herbs?   Once again comments were how "fresh" it tasted, almost too fresh.  Just a slight tang at the end of the palate.   Wonderful beer, wish I had more than 2 pints.
Pint @ Volo Toronto, . The best Hefe Ive had to date. Very flavorful, bananas,cloves little citrus among other spices. Great body & absolutely delicious hefe

Pint at volo. Cloudy pale yellow colour with a big thick white head and thick lacing on the glass. Aromas of wheat, banana, fruit and mild citrus. Fruity taste (cherry, peach, banana) with some wheat, clove and grain notes as well. A very smooth and creamy mouthfeel. Wonderfully refreshing and thirst quenching on a hot day. I was very excited to try this beer, and it has definitely lived up to its reputation. I will be buying this one a lot this summer.
draft at volo in toronto.  cloudy yellow with large white head that dissipates.  good aroma of wheat and malt with hint of citrus.  mildly sweet, the flavor is fruity and yeasty.

Ive had this one on tap at Volo and Cest What many times. Best canadian-made german-style hefeweizen Ive tried. Lovely yeasty, banana armoa with well balanced taste with nice clove and spice notes.

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2007 On tap at Volo. I was quite surprised by this one. Orangeish-yellow pale colour. Smell was sweet and reminiscient of banana peel. Flavour was immediately of bananas, cloves and citrus with a very very light hint of lemon. Mouthfeel was medium and it had quite a nice body to it. I was surprised to find something so good for so cheap, and the ratings here confirm that Im not the only one who thinks so.

EDIT: Had a very bad pint recently at Volo that tasted like it was fermented in corn. Not sure if there are QC issues with the brewery, but I was just taken aback by the major change.
Tap - Deep yellow with nice white head.  Aroma of spices, wheat, banana, cloves.  Same flavors.  Sweet.... well balanced.
UPDATED: MAR 12, 2007 excellent german wiesse. great citrus punch, extemely well balanced, such a nice beer.

Ive been drinking this one since Denisons days as a brewpub. It was a classic then, and is a classic now. Tons of banana on the nose, lovely body, lots of nice lacing. The banana is present in the taste as well. Slightly-cloudy looking. Damnit Michael, bottle this stuff already.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2008 Huge banana aroma with some cloves and plenty of wheat character.  Opaque yellow-blonde body is topped by a decent stand of bright, white, fine bubbled head that lasts throughout and coats the sides of the glass.  Banana flavour is strong but never overpowers the wheat tartness with cloves shining through in the aftertaste.  Very nicely blanced, the flavour evolves across the tastebuds.  Medium light body with strong, crisp carbonation that cleanses the palate and awakens the mouth.  Smooth texture.  Excellent!  Enjoyed on tap at Cest What!  Original rating at Cest What? during the 2006 football season when the Als were in Toronto.  Resampled during Grey Cup weekend 2007 at Caffe Volo with similar notes and score.
had it on tap at many places, Shaghai cowgirl was the last, lotsa head good banana, clove nose, full body golden colour with definate haziness. Great pint

On tap at beer bistro. I was excited to try this beer. Came to me with a thick head, the beer itself having a murky golden color. It was a bit disappointing at first in its subtleness, but as I continued to drink it, it grew on me rapidly. To me, this is the ideal hefeweizen.

UPDATED: NOV 14, 2009 On tap at Shanghai Cowgirl - came with a dense two-finger head.  Colour is an opaque gold, with some brightness at the edges.  Aroma of yeast, banana, citrus fruits and some spices.  Taste is much the same, hugely complex and a full body.  Banana is surprising, delicious and not overpowering.
